body.p: The Board noted that an accounting mismatch could arise for entities that hold assets to fund the obligation that do not qualify as plan assets because an entity would recognise changes in the defined benefit obligation in other comprehensive income, but changes in the carrying amount of those assets in profit or loss. The Board considered whether to permit (or perhaps require) entities to recognise the remeasurement component in profit or loss if that would reduce or eliminate an accounting mismatch from profit or loss.
